decks.notes: The deck focuses on aggressive creatures that disrupt the opponent's game plan, also known as Hatebears. By playing cards like Archon of Emeria and Void Mirror, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's spells and mana development. The deck also utilizes efficient mana sources like Chrome Mox and Ancient Tomb to power out threats quickly. With a mix of disruptive creatures and hate cards, the deck aims to control the game and apply pressure on the opponent to secure a victory.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on using powerful spells and card advantage to control the game and out-value opponents. It utilizes a mix of counterspells, removal, and card draw to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also setting up its own win conditions. The deck also includes a companion card, Lurrus of the Dream-Den, to provide additional value and recursion. With a strong mana base and a mix of efficient threats and disruption, this deck aims to outmaneuver and outlast opponents in a 1 vs 1 format.

This deck revolves around generating a large amount of mana quickly and using it to cast Paradoxical Outcome to draw into more cards and recast your artifacts for additional value. The deck includes several artifact mana sources, card draw engines, and combo pieces like Tolarian Academy and Time Vault to create a powerful engine that can overwhelm your opponent in a short amount of time. The goal is to assemble your combo pieces and generate a winning board state through efficient card draw and mana acceleration.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponents with hatebears while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. It leverages mana acceleration and disruptive cards like Wasteland, Trinisphere, and Chancellor of the Annex to slow down opponents, while also using cards like Seasoned Dungeoneer and Archon of Emeria to apply pressure. The deck aims to control the game tempo, disrupt opponent's strategies, and close out the game quickly with efficient creatures. The mana base is streamlined for consistency and speed, allowing for a fast and disruptive game plan.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the necessary artifacts to generate a large amount of mana and draw cards with Paradoxical Outcome. The key combo pieces include Coveted Jewel, Mana Vault, Grim Monolith, Voltaic Key, and Manifold Key to generate mana and draw into win conditions like The One Ring or Sink into Stupor. The deck aims to control the game with counterspells like Force of Will and disruption cards like Trinisphere while setting up the combo to win the game in a single explosive turn.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining card advantage through powerful draw effects like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time. It aims to control the game through countermagic like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, as well as removal spells like Fatal Push. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Null Rod and Wasteland to slow down the opponent's game plan. By using a combination of control elements and powerful threats like Psychic Frog, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with hatebears like Anointed Peacekeeper, Archon of Emeria, and Chancellor of the Annex, while also deploying aggressive creatures like Clarion Conqueror and Seasoned Dungeoneer to close out the game quickly. The inclusion of disruptive artifacts like Chrome Mox and Void Mirror further hinders the opponent's strategy, allowing the player to control the board and apply pressure. The deck is designed to be efficient and aggressive, aiming to overwhelm the opponent before they can establish their own game plan.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by utilizing hatebear creatures like Anointed Peacekeeper and Archon of Emeria. It also utilizes cards like Chancellor of the Annex and Void Mirror to prevent the opponent from casting spells easily. The deck also includes fast mana sources like Black Lotus and Moxen to accelerate its game plan. Overall, the deck focuses on aggressive disruption and proactive plays to control the game and limit the opponent's options, while still maintaining a strong board presence with cards like Seasoned Dungeoneer and White Plume Adventurer.

The deck focuses on using a combination of disruption and card advantage to control the game and out-value the opponent. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm, while also having removal like Swords to Plowshares for threats. The deck can generate card advantage with Ancestral Recall, Stock Up, and Treasure Cruise, ensuring a steady stream of resources. Additionally, the deck utilizes powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and the Moxen to accelerate its game plan and maintain tempo.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure through efficient creatures. By utilizing hate cards such as Void Mirror and Chancellor of the Annex, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's plays and control the board. The inclusion of disruptive creatures like Archon of Emeria and Anointed Peacekeeper further adds to the game plan of hindering the opponent's strategy. With a mix of mana acceleration and disruptive elements, this deck looks to overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggressive creatures and hate cards.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponents' strategies with hatebears like Archon of Emeria and Chancellor of the Annex while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Clarion Conqueror and White Plume Adventurer. The deck also utilizes mana acceleration through cards like Chrome Mox and the Moxen, as well as disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Strip Mine and Wasteland to disrupt opponents' mana bases. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and outpace opponents with efficient creatures and disruption.

The main idea of the deck is to utilize graveyard recursion and self-mill mechanics to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Golgari Grave-Troll, Ichorid, and Prized Amalgam. This allows for explosive plays and combos, generating advantage while overwhelming the opponent. Cards like Creeping Chill and Shambling Shell provide additional value and synergy with the graveyard strategy. The deck also includes disruption elements like Force of Will and Chalice of the Void to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to win quickly and decisively through graveyard shenanigans and powerful synergy.

The deck revolves around using Coveted Jewel to generate mana and draw cards, while utilizing artifact ramp such as Manifold Key and Grim Monolith to power out game-winning combos such as Time Vault and Mystic Forge. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and protect them with counter magic like Force of Will, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Sink into Stupor. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful artifacts and game-ending combos, utilizing the Vintage card pool to its fullest potential.

This deck aims to disrupt opponents by limiting their resources with cards like Wasteland, Void Mirror, and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, while also putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures like Archon of Emeria and Chancellor of the Annex. It also has a strong focus on controlling the opponent's board with cards like Karakas and White Plume Adventurer. The deck aims to quickly establish board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on using artifact creatures and mana denial cards to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive threats. By utilizing powerful artifacts like Mishra's Workshop and Trinisphere, as well as mana acceleration tools such as Sol Ring and Mana Crypt, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly. With a mix of disruptive elements like Null Rod and Sphere of Resistance, along with resilient threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Stonecoil Serpent, the deck aims to control the game and secure victory through a mix of efficient creatures and disruptive spells.

This deck aims to quickly assemble a powerful board state by utilizing artifact mana acceleration and card draw spells to cast Paradoxical Outcome, bouncing back multiple artifacts to their hand and drawing more cards. The combo relies on generating a large amount of mana and card advantage to overwhelm the opponent in a single turn, taking advantage of cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk to further solidify the victory. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional recursion and flexibility in the deck strategy.
